body.p:
Frankfort Apl 14th 1864
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

We whose names are underwritten would respectfully represent that Calvin Fairbank now and for more than Twelve years past an inmate of the State prison is in feeble health without much prosepct of growing better. He is represented to us as having been both faithful and obedient as a prisoner submitting cheerfully to all the requirements of the institution. We feel satisfied that no injury can result to any human being by his release, but his pardon would be an act of well deserved clemency.

H Rodman
Jas S Sneed
L. Tobin
H. C. Fleming
Thos. J. Frazier
J B Lampton
N. Heffner
Thomas L. Hutchison
Robert. C. Steele
D. W. Bowen
J. B. Tharp.
A. W. Vallandingham
T. Callahan
H Hardee
R. W. Lawler
Geo A. Robertson
